contents: Article 22 (Athlete Relief) ① If the athlete requests the head of the affiliated organization and the head of the city/provincial sports organization to issue a transfer consent form, but the head of the affiliated organization or the head of the city/provincial sports organization does not issue the transfer consent form without special reasons, the athlete may be a member of the relevant member sport. An application for relief can be made to an organization, and member sports organizations can present their opinions to the head of the relevant organization after deliberation and coordination by the relevant committee within one month of receiving the application for relief. ② Despite the committee's recommendation to issue a transfer consent form pursuant to paragraph 1, if the head of the affiliated organization or the head of the city/provincial sports organization does not issue a transfer consent within 15 days without a justifiable reason, the athlete concerned will register with the member sports organization without a transfer consent. Changes can be applied for, and member sports organizations must notify the head of the affiliated organization, the head of the city/provincial sports organization, and the applicant for relief of the change in registration. ③ If a registered athlete is unreasonably restricted in his/her activities due to these regulations or special reasons, the relevant committee of the member sports organization may decide to provide relief.
